section.title: How to obtain XHTML compliance for FusionForge
section.para: The complete XHTML specification is available at XHTML specification at www.w3c.org.
Here is listed a summary of what is needed to be XHTML compliant:

listitem.para: All pages should have the following xml declaration:
listitem.programlisting: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd"> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="en" lang="en">

listitem.para: All open tags must be closed, all tags must stay between < and >.

No standalone
tag is allowed;
must be used.

section.para: The differences listed here are the most significant differences between HTML and XHTML, there are other, minor differences. For a complete list, refer to the XHTML specification.
